coref: A Fox was caught in a trap one fine morning, because A Fox had got too near the Farmer's hen house. No doubt A Fox was hungry, but that was not an excuse for stealing. A Cock, rising early, discovered what had happened. A Fox knew A Fox A Fox could not get at A Fox, so A Fox went a little closer to get a good look at A Fox enemy. A Fox A Fox saw a slender chance of escape. Dear friend, A Fox said, I was just on my way to visit a sick relative, when I stumbled into this string and got all tangled up. But please do not tell anybody about it. I dislike causing sorrow to anybody, and I am sure I can soon gnaw this string to pieces. But A Cock was not to be so easily fooled. A Cock soon roused the whole hen yard, and when the Farmer came running out, that was the end of A Fox.
